title: smooki3
author: smooki3
content: What happened:: Hy guys, I got contacted by a person, who has been scammed by viperatech.com and it has been a brutal scam. He explained this to me and inquired to tell his story, which goes like this: 3 months ago he has bought a miner from them and everything was ok, he has received his miner and they have earned his trust. A month ago they have contacted him with the offer to preorder 10 units of S19 XP of the exclusive price of $10 000 per unit (not like in their website ($13 900). They have asked for 40% payment of the offered price to reserve his 10 units now, for the August batch.He had agreed and the transfer of the money have been made on the same day. When he has asked them to confirm the receipt of his crypto they have denied that the transfer have been made. On the next day when he has asked them again to confirm his transfer they have told him that he have never bought or preoredered something from them. They have completely ignored his payment and the receiving of it. They have denied that they have contacted him for the preordering of these units. So he got stung with such huge amount of money by this so called ‘’trusted vendor’’ I can see that something is happening on their trustpilot page. There are some reviews which are explaining similar behavior. Not delivered products, ignore and rejections.. One of the reviews caught my attention, because first viperatech’s respond was exactly like the others, but after the review was verified, they changed the reply with a number of already delivered order to different address as the person who have written the review is from Spain, but the number shows delivery to ‘’MCCLEARY, WA US’’ signed from C. Cunningham and its from 3 months ago. This only my speculation.I think, if the above is true, they have washed their hands of, with this reply and some real number from 3 months ago just to look legit and to lure more people like the person for which I’m telling you about in this thread. Not to mention that the fact that they are not on asicminervalue.com anymore speaks for itself.Reference Link: https://www.viperatech.com/Proof of Payment: This is what he sent to me:https://ibb.co/NNrzjMshttps://ibb.co/sbnKbmqhttps://ibb.co/bQcDJX8Additional Notes: Scammers are getting smarter with each passing day, and everyone needs to be very careful in this bear market. My opinion is that if they had capital and bought some products to send some items to gain trust and later steal more, this is a small sacrifice in the face of a bigger picture that cannot be neglected.I leave it to you to decide and make your own conclusions.

comments.body: Viperatech is one of the top sellers on Asicminervalue and accept credit cards. If they were scamming anybody, they wouldnt last a week on those platforms. Also, that is not their BTC address and they only accept USDT unless you’re paying through Coinpal using a credit card.This is an impostor using Viperatech’s invoicing system to trick people. Based on that second screenshot, it’s obvious this was a phishing scam. Vipera NEVER solicits people via email like the Chinese do, and don’t just plop a BTC address down in the same paragraph as an offer. That address is not theirs. Lastly— they never accept deposits either, even for preorders. Try ordering from them, you’ll see for yourself.
